page.title: 03BLACK TORRINGTON POPULATION
page.content: There are 90 dwelling houses occupied by 199 people. 50% are adults aged 18 to 65, 25% old age pensioners, 15% boys and 10% girls. In the remainder of the block live approximately 100 people.Total population has declined by over half in the last century. Housing comprises 26 detached houses or cottages, 22 semi-detached, 21 terraced and 21 bungalows. 39 families have lived in the area for over 20 years, 32 between 5 and 20 and 31 for less than 5 years. Most families own cars, as Hatherleigh is 6 miles, Holsworthy 9 and Exeter 33. Known cars comprise 18 Fords, 18 British Leyland, 3 Fiat, Vauxhall, Renault, 2 Audi, Citroen, Volkswagen and 1 Datsun, BMW, Saab, Honda and Volvo, also 2 motor cycles, Yamaha and Suzuki. Of 21 primary school pupils, 10 come by car and 11 walk to school.
